page.title: 18South Square
page.content: The South Square complex was officially opened by the Mayor of Bradford on Saturday April 20th 1985. As well as the activities already there at South Square this date saw the opening of a centre for tourism, a local museum and exhibition area, craft shop and tea room. The centre will be used for wool sales, Spring Auctions, art and craft and photography workshops and fund raising functions. There is a pottery called 'The Pothole' run by a local artist who will undertake private commisssions. You are encouraged to watch the pottery being made. The South Square project has been organised completely by local people for use by the community.
